fields.title: We Are Shaping Sustainable Surf
fields.content:
Our passion is surfing, our commitment is sustainability.


We offer online video tutorials for surfers and shapers, who want to acquire or progress their surfboard shaping skills while minimizing their environmental impact.


Why Buy From Us?

Committed to Sustainability:

We are dedicated to providing a sustainable alternative in the surfing industry.


Unmatched Support:

Our dedicated shapers will provide you the support you need throughout your build, no matter your skills (or lack of them).


Interactive Q&A Sessions:

Participate in regular live Q&A sessions with our surfboard shaping instructors. Get your questions answered directly and gain valuable insights from experienced shapers - and surfers! We live what we love.

Exclusive access for customers.


High-Quality Content:

Our lessons are professionally produced and regularly updated with new techniques and materials.


Order your custom-made surfboard from us:

If you lack the time or are not confident enough to shape the perfect eco-friendly wave-catcher yourself, contact us for a custom-made sustainable surfboard. 


Just fill out our detailed contact form and we'll get in touch with a custom-made proposal.


Check out our collection of custom-made sustainable eco-friendly surfboards for inspiration in the about section of our website.


Ride the wave of change and shape the future of surf with us! Get your sustainable surfboards and help us mitigate climate change, one wave at a time.


Coming soon:

Community Forum and Riversurfboards. Subscribe to our Newsletter and be the first to know!


All newsletter subscribers receive a welcoming discount code!

fields.question: What materials are commonly used for building sustainable surfboards and fins?
fields.answer:
Recycled EPS Foam: 

This replaces the traditional polyurethane foam, which has a higher environmental impact during production. Recycled EPS foam uses pre-consumer or post-consumer waste, reducing reliance on virgin materials.

Cork:

This lightweight and naturally buoyant material can be used as a deck layer or incorporated into the rails of a surfboard for added dampening and a unique aesthetic.

Bamboo:

Can be used on top of recycled EPS foam for a strong, lightweight, and fast-growing sustainable alternative.

Wood:

For an even more natural ride, hollow wood can be a sustainable alternative, offering excellent glide ability without fiberglass or EPS foam. Reclaimed wood or fast-growing bamboo are ideal choices to minimize negative or detrimental environmental impact.

fields.question: LCA - Life Cycle Analysis. What is it and why is it important?
fields.answer:
LCA - Life Cycle Analysis:

Ultimately, a LCA focusses on what we take from the environment, in terms of raw materials and energy, and what impact the product then has on the environment during its lifetime (its use, its service, etc.).

fields.name: Ecoboard Sustainable Surf
fields.description: Eco-friendly surfboard materials. Overview.

fields.name: Dial In Your Ride: Measuring Surfboard Length and Volume
fields.description:
Finding the perfect surfboard size is crucial for performance and enjoyment!

This video lesson dives deep into measuring surfboard length and volume, empowering you to choose the ideal board for your surfing location, surfing style and body type. Learn how to use simple tools to accurately measure your desired board dimensions and calculate its volume.

Before you begin building your own sustainable surfboard, this video equips you with the knowledge to make informed decisions.

fields.name: Sustainable Surfboard Design: Performance Characteristics Explained
fields.description:
Dive deeper into the world of surfboard design!

This video lesson explores the relationship between board shape, materials, and performance characteristics.

Learn how to choose the right eco-friendly materials and design elements to build a surfboard that perfectly matches your surfing style and desired wave conditions.

fields.name: Beyond the Shape: Eco-Friendly Fin Systems and Sustainable Fin Selection
fields.description:
Optimize your eco-surfboard's performance!

This video lesson explores sustainable fin system options and guides you in selecting the perfect eco-friendly fins to complement your board's design.

Learn how to maximize control, maneuverability, and overall surfing experience with fins and a focus on environmental responsibility.

fields.name: Shortboard Shaping for High-Performance Surfing
fields.description:
Carve turns like a pro!

This video lesson guides you through building a high-performance shortboard using sustainable materials.

Learn how to shape a board for speed, maneuverability, and optimal wave riding in powerful conditions!

fields.name: Fish Shape Mastery: Sustainable Speed and Fun
fields.description:
Embrace the versatility of a fish shape!

This video lesson explores building a sustainable fish surfboard, ideal for catching smaller waves and performing radical maneuvers.

Learn how to shape a board for looseness, speed generation, and playful surfing.

fields.name: Sustainable Mini-Malibu Shaping: Craft Your Surfing Journey from the Ground Up
fields.description:
Imagine riding your first wave on a surfboard you built with your own hands!

This video lesson empowers you to shape a sustainable mini-malibu surfboard, the perfect launchpad for your surfing journey to experience a deeper connection to the ocean and the sport of surfing.

Learn how to shape a board that prioritizes stability, paddling ease, and wave-catching ability, all while minimizing your environmental impact.

fields.name: Eco-Friendly Buoyancy - How to Choose Materials
fields.description:
This video dives into the deep sea of materials commonly used for building sustainable surfboards and fins.

Learn how to choose the right material for your surfing style!
